info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 6:21PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Elbert, southwestern Hart and southern Abbeville Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 620 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Abbeville to 9 miles southeast of Elberton to 6 miles east of Danielsville. Movement was southwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Elberton, Calhoun Falls, Bowman, Lowndesville, Bobby Brown State Park, Lake Strom Thurmond, Russell State Park, Nancy Hart State Park and Middleton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
